page.title: 08LIVING IN "TIN TOWN"
page.content:
{CALDECOTE,SMALL VILLAGE,CAMBRIDGESHIRE
LOCALLY,CALDECOTE IS NICKNAMED"TIN TOWN." THIS IS BECAUSE OF THE WAY THE EARLIEST BUILDINGS WERE MADE. SOME WERE OLD RAILWAY CARRIAGES;SOME WERE LITTLE MORE THAN SHACKS WITH A TIMBER FRAME COVERED BY SHEETS OF CORRUGATED IRON.NOW SOME NEWCOMERS LIVE IN CARAVANS FOR A WHILE. GRADUALLY,THESE TEMPORARY HOUSES HAVE BEEN REPLACED BY PERMANENT BRICK HOUSES,OF VERY INDIVIDUAL STYLE.HERE IS A REPORT OF THE WAY ONE FAMILY HAS COPED WITH IMPROVING ITS HOUSE.
REPORT FROM ANDREW FORDHAM OF 74, WEST DRIVE, HIGHFIELDS AGED 9
CONT ON PAGE 9
